snippet: The Financial Stability Board, a body that coordinates international bank regulations, has come out with its list of "systemically important" big banks. Of the 28 firms on the list, eight are from the United States.
abstract: The Financial Stability Board, a body that coordinates international bank regulations, has come out with its list of "systemically important" big banks. Of the 28 firms on the list, eight are from the United States.

headline.main: The List That Big Banks Don't Wish to Be On
